intro: Mongezia, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaryllidaceae. It consists of several species native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. These plants are characterized by their attractive, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in spring. The leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, forming a basal rosette. Mongezia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and are relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
